results.title: An Open space secondary school at work
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, John Morris and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Shows how individual differences in students’ capacity to learn can in fact be used to benefit their intellectual growth. It gives an inside view of an Open Space School in operation, showing the advantages and day-to-day methods used in the Open Space School layout. Some of the problems which must be faced and solved by staff as well as students to promote an efficient and effective school are discussed.
results.title_for_label: An Open space secondary school at work
results.creator_credit_for_label: South Australian Film Corporation, John Morris and Ron Saunders

results.title: An old box
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Gaston Sarault and Paul Driessen
results.brief_description: An animated story of a beggar who repairs an old box, in order to set it up and ask for donations. As he stands in the street he gets cold, so he climbs into the box to keep warm. At once a spectacular star descends from the sky to the box and when it returns to the sky, it takes with it the ghost of the beggar. A film without words. (Awards: Chicago; San Franscisco; Melbourne; Dubuque: Los Angeles; Les Menuires.)

results.title: An Occurrence at Owl Creek Bridge
results.creator_credit: Filmartic, Films du Centaure, Robert Enrico, Marcel Ichac and Paul de Roubaix
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of a short story by Ambrose Bierce set during the American Civil War in which a Confederate citizen stands on the scaffold, about to be hanged, and seems, as by a series of miracles, to escape death.

results.title: An Italian family: life on a farm
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes
results.brief_description: This film presents geographic and cultural aspects of Italy with an account of one family living on a small farm, who, unlike many Italians seeking modernisation, avoid mechanisation in preference for a simple way of life. With collaboration by Edoardo Capolino.

results.title: An Irish Medley 423
results.brief_description: Englishman Reginald Foot plays and sings ten Irish national melodies such as Londonderry Air, Killarney and St Patrick’s Day which are paired with scenes of rural Ireland.

results.title: An Invitation to Japan
results.brief_description: Shows the tourist attractions found along Japan’s most representative travel route: Tokyo, Nikko, Kamakura, Hakone, Kyoto, Nara, Osaka, highlighting such places as the Great Buddha at Kamakura, the Olympic Games site and the Toshogu Shrine at Nikko. Also shows typical Japanese food, pearls, kimonos, porcelain and textiles.

results.title: An Introduction to visual illusions (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Caldwell-Halls Productions, Stanley Halls and John Caldwell
results.brief_description: Professor Joseph Lyons explains the functions of the eye and the brain in perception, how the brain collates information about distance, perspective and movement. A variety of ingenious film techniques are used to illustrate visual illusions.

results.title: An Introduction to vectors: coplanar concurrent forces
results.creator_credit: Loucks and Norling Studios and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: Explains the meaning of scalar and vector quantities; how to add scalars and vectors; methods of vector composition and vector resolution; relationship between vector composition and vector resolution; and how vectors may be used to solve engineering problems.
